net.xqhs.util.config

Interface Configurable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Config

    public interface Configurable
    The Configurable interface is meant to be used as an interface / paradigm for any class that separates construction-time configuration methods from the rest of the instance's lifecycle. It is particularly appropriate for classes that need a large number of parameters and consider both optional and default parameters.

    While the interface itself does not offer many methods, it is expected from a class implementing Configurable that it will offer a number of setters, and will respect the guidelines set in Config.

    For further reference on this paradigm, see Config.

    Author:
    Andrei Olaru

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Config build()
      This method should always be an alias of lock().
      void ensureLocked()
      This method should check the locking status and call lock() only once in the lifetime of the instance.
      Config lock()
      'Locks' the configuration, meaning that construction time is over.
      void locked()
      Should be called at the entry point of methods that should not be called after the instance has been 'locked'.
      Configurable makeDefaults()
      Initializes all optional parameters to their default value.

    • Method Detail

      • makeDefaults

        Configurable makeDefaults()
        Initializes all optional parameters to their default value.

        From Config guidelines:

        • IMPORTANT: Remember that all initialization of the fields will be done after the call of makeDefaults()
        • makeDefaults() should always begin by calling super.makeDefaults(), and then making necessary adjustments.
        • makeDefaults() should only affect fields (from the ancestor configs) that have a default value for the configured object that is relevant to the configured object (and not to the ancestor).
        • Setting of changeable parameters (either by constructors, makeDefaults(), or other setters) will always be done by calling the appropriate setter function.
        Returns:
        the instance itself.

      • lock

        Config lock()
        'Locks' the configuration, meaning that construction time is over.

        in case any construction needs to be made, it should be done in this method, after calling super.lock().

        Returns:
        the instance itself.

      • build

        Config build()
        This method should always be an alias of lock(). The difference is only semantic: build() should be associated with actually building the configured instance, and lock() should be associated with locking the configuration / values of configured parameters.
        Returns:
        the instance itself

      • ensureLocked

        void ensureLocked()
        This method should check the locking status and call lock() only once in the lifetime of the instance.

        This can be called by various methods that need to ensure the locking has been performed, also resulting in a call to lock() the first time this method is called.

      • locked

        void locked()
            throws Config.ConfigLockedException
        Should be called at the entry point of methods that should not be called after the instance has been 'locked'.

        In case such a call is made, the method should throw the specified exception.

        Throws:
        Config.ConfigLockedException
